message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: try {
    File file = new File("C:/Users/Me/Desktop/directory/file.txt");
    PrintWriter printWriter = new PrintWriter(file);
    printWriter.println("hello");
    printWriter.close();
} catch (Exception e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue is that you are not providing the full path to the file when creating the PrintWriter object. You need to pass the File object that represents the file you want to write to, instead of just the file name. Additionally, make sure that the directory "C:/Users/Me/Desktop/directory/" exists before running the program.
